column4: hey in Synaptic, the latest version of the program they list isn't actually the latest, is this normal?
for example they dont even have Pidgin instead of Gaim
You're still in feisty, aren't you
Yes.  That's normal.  Each version of Ubuntu has frozen versions of software (besides bugfixes)
You can upgrade via the internet.  Don't use a CD.  It'll save you on bandwidth too
Feisty will only ever have the stuff it was released with.  You should upgrade to gutsy if you want the newer stuff.
Thats the easiest and most hassle free method.
You can.  But you should use package management.  Its easier and friendlier during upgrades.
You don't want to do it that way.  You should just upgrade to gutsy.
Latest in that sense means latest in the repositories.  Which is different than latest released ever.
because you need to have update-manager up to date to do the gutsy upgrade
Theyre different, they suit different needs
Check out edubuntu.org, they've got a pretty informative site
No, thats wrong.  Theyre both just as capable.  Edubuntu can install as a regular system, or as the LTSP/thin-client thing.
Instead of being mouse point/click its keyboard arrow point/click
nope.  Its just menus that are text based
The questions are essentially the same
